column2: VARDESC
During the past 90 days, how many times did you go to an emergency room for your alcohol or drug use problems?
During the past 90 days, how many . . . days did you go to any other kind of treatment provider or work with some other kind of case manager about your alcohol or drug use problems?
During the past 90 days, how many . . . nights were you in a halfway house, residential, inpatient, or hospital program (for your alcohol or drug use problems)
During the past 90 days, how many . . . days were you in an intensive outpatient or day program (for your alcohol or drug use problems)?
During the past 90 days, how many . . . times did you go to a regular (1–8 hours per week) outpatient program (for your alcohol or drug use problems)?
During the past 90 days, how many . . . days did you take medication like methadone or antabuse to help with withdrawal or cravings?
During the past 90 days, you . . . were willing to talk about your feelings during counseling.
During the past 90 days, you . . . made progress with your drug/alcohol problems.
During the past 90 days, you . . . learned to analyze and plan ways to solve your problems.
During the past 90 days, you . . . made progress toward your treatment program goals.
During the past 90 days, you . . . always attend the counseling sessions scheduled for you.
During the past 90 days, you . . . stopped or greatly reduced your drug use while in this program.
During the past 90 days, you . . . always participate actively in your counseling sessions.
During the past 90 days, you . . . made progress in understanding your feelings and behavior.
During the past 90 days, you . . . improved your relations with other people because of this treatment
During the past 90 days, you . . . made progress with your emotional or psychological issues.
During the past 90 days, you . . . gave honest feedback during counseling.
During the past 90 days, you . . . followed your counselor’s guidance.
During the past 90 days . . . I am fully committed to the program.
During the past 90 days . . . The program is creating more problems for me than it is solving.
During the past 90 days . . . I’m moving through treatment at the right pace.
During the past 90 days . . . I personally care about the reputation of this program.
During the past 90 days . . . The staff are genuinely concerned about me.
During the past 90 days . . . What goes on here has little relevance to the real world.
During the past 90 days . . . I think a lot of what goes on here “is not for me.”
During the past 90 days . . . I feel grateful and appreciative to the program.
During the past 90 days . . . I cannot identify with most people in the program.
During the past 90 days . . . In this program, I feel like I’m just doing time.
During the past 90 days . . . I feel genuine concern, even love, from people around me.
